docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that transcribes the audio content of a YouTube video into text.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block takes a YouTube video URL as input and produces a text transcript of the video's audio content. It also extracts and provides the unique video ID associated with the YouTube video.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block first extracts the video ID from the provided YouTube URL. It then uses this ID to fetch the video's transcript. The transcript is processed and formatted into a readable text format. If any errors occur during this process, the block will capture and report them.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description YouTube URL The web address of the YouTube video you want to transcribe. This can be in various formats, such as a standard watch URL, a shortened URL, or an embed URL.

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Video ID The unique identifier for the YouTube video, extracted from the input URL. Transcript The full text transcript of the video's audio content. Error Any error message that occurs if the transcription process fails.

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A content creator could use this block to automatically generate subtitles for their YouTube videos. They could also use it to create text-based summaries of video content for SEO purposes or to make their content more accessible to hearing-impaired viewers.

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 该模块能够将YouTube视频中的音频内容转录为文本。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 此模块接收一个YouTube视频的URL作为输入，并生成该视频音频内容的文字转录。同时，它还会提取并提供与该YouTube视频相关联的唯一视频ID。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 模块首先从提供的YouTube URL中提取视频ID。随后，利用此ID获取视频的转录文本。转录内容经过处理，被格式化为易于阅读的文本形式。在此过程中若发生任何错误，模块将捕获并报告这些错误。

docs.title: 输入项
docs.text: 输入项 描述 YouTube URL 您希望转录的YouTube视频的网络地址。可以是多种格式，如标准观看URL、短链接或嵌入URL。

docs.title: 输出项
docs.text: 输出项 描述 视频ID 从输入URL中提取的YouTube视频的唯一标识符。 转录文本 视频音频内容的完整文字转录。 错误信息 如果转录过程中出现失败，将显示的错误消息。

docs.title: 应用场景
docs.text: 内容创作者可以利用此模块自动为其YouTube视频生成字幕。此外，他们还可以利用转录文本创建视频内容的文字摘要，以优化SEO（搜索引擎优化），或使内容对听力障碍观众更加友好。

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that posts comments on GitHub issues or pull requests.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to add comments to existing GitHub issues or pull requests using the GitHub API.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block takes the GitHub credentials, the URL of the issue or pull request, and the comment text as inputs. It then sends a request to the GitHub API to post the comment on the specified issue or pull request.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication information Issue URL The URL of the GitHub issue or pull request where the comment will be posted Comment The text content of the comment to be posted

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description ID The unique identifier of the created comment URL The direct link to the posted comment on GitHub Error Any error message if the comment posting fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Automating responses to issues in a GitHub repository, such as thanking contributors for their submissions or providing status updates on reported bugs.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that creates new issues on GitHub repositories.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to create new issues in a specified GitHub repository with a title and body content.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block takes the GitHub credentials, repository URL, issue title, and issue body as inputs. It then sends a request to the GitHub API to create a new issue with the provided information.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication information Repo URL The URL of the GitHub repository where the issue will be created Title The title of the new issue Body The main content or description of the new issue

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Number The issue number assigned by GitHub URL The direct link to the newly created issue on GitHub Error Any error message if the issue creation fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Automatically creating issues for bug reports or feature requests submitted through an external system or form.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves information about a specific GitHub issue.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block fetches the details of a given GitHub issue, including its title, body content, and the user who created it.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block takes the GitHub credentials and the issue URL as inputs. It then sends a request to the GitHub API to fetch the issue's details and returns the relevant information.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication information Issue URL The URL of the GitHub issue to be read

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Title The title of the issue Body The main content or description of the issue User The username of the person who created the issue Error Any error message if reading the issue fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Gathering information about reported issues for analysis or to display on a dashboard.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves a list of issues from a GitHub repository.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block fetches all open issues from a specified GitHub repository and provides their titles and URLs.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block takes the GitHub credentials and repository URL as inputs. It then sends a request to the GitHub API to fetch the list of issues and returns their details.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication information Repo URL The URL of the GitHub repository to list issues from

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Issue A list of issues, each containing: - Title The title of the issue - URL The direct link to the issue on GitHub Error Any error message if listing the issues fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Creating a summary of open issues for a project status report or displaying them on a project management dashboard.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that adds a label to a GitHub issue or pull request.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to add a specified label to an existing GitHub issue or pull request.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block takes the GitHub credentials, the URL of the issue or pull request, and the label to be added as inputs. It then sends a request to the GitHub API to add the label to the specified issue or pull request.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication information Issue URL The URL of the GitHub issue or pull request to add the label to Label The name of the label to be added

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Status A message indicating whether the label was successfully added Error Any error message if adding the label fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Automatically categorizing issues based on their content or assigning priority labels to newly created issues.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that removes a label from a GitHub issue or pull request.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to remove a specified label from an existing GitHub issue or pull request.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block takes the GitHub credentials, the URL of the issue or pull request, and the label to be removed as inputs. It then sends a request to the GitHub API to remove the label from the specified issue or pull request.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication information Issue URL The URL of the GitHub issue or pull request to remove the label from Label The name of the label to be removed

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Status A message indicating whether the label was successfully removed Error Any error message if removing the label fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Updating the status of issues as they progress through a workflow, such as removing a "In Progress" label when an issue is completed.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that assigns a user to a GitHub issue.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to assign a specific GitHub user to an existing issue.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block takes the GitHub credentials, the URL of the issue, and the username of the person to be assigned as inputs. It then sends a request to the GitHub API to assign the specified user to the issue.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication information Issue URL The URL of the GitHub issue to assign Assignee The username of the person to be assigned to the issue

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Status A message indicating whether the issue was successfully assigned Error Any error message if assigning the issue fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Automatically assigning new issues to team members based on their expertise or workload.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that unassigns a user from a GitHub issue.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to remove a specific GitHub user's assignment from an existing issue.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block takes the GitHub credentials, the URL of the issue, and the username of the person to be unassigned as inputs. It then sends a request to the GitHub API to remove the specified user's assignment from the issue.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication information Issue URL The URL of the GitHub issue to unassign Assignee The username of the person to be unassigned from the issue

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Status A message indicating whether the issue was successfully unassigned Error Any error message if unassigning the issue fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Automatically unassigning issues that have been inactive for a certain period or when reassigning workload among team members.

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个用于在 GitHub 问题或拉取请求上发布评论的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块允许用户使用 GitHub API 在现有的 GitHub 问题或拉取请求上添加评论。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块接收 GitHub 凭据、问题或拉取请求的 URL 以及评论文本作为输入。然后，它向 GitHub API 发送请求，在指定的问题或拉取请求上发布评论。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 GitHub 认证信息 问题 URL 将在其上发布评论的 GitHub 问题或拉取请求的 URL 评论 要发布的评论的文本内容

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 ID 创建的评论的唯一标识符 URL 在 GitHub 上发布的评论的直接链接 错误 如果评论发布失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 自动化对 GitHub 仓库中问题的响应，例如感谢贡献者的提交或提供报告错误的状态更新。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个用于在 GitHub 仓库中创建新问题的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块允许用户在指定的 GitHub 仓库中创建带有标题和正文内容的新问题。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块接收 GitHub 凭据、仓库 URL、问题标题和问题正文作为输入。然后，它向 GitHub API 发送请求，使用提供的信息创建新问题。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 GitHub 认证信息 仓库 URL 将在其中创建问题的 GitHub 仓库的 URL 标题 新问题的标题 正文 新问题的主要内容或描述

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 编号 GitHub 分配的问题编号 URL 在 GitHub 上新创建的问题的直接链接 错误 如果问题创建失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 自动为通过外部系统或表单提交的错误报告或功能请求创建问题。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个用于检索特定 GitHub 问题信息的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块获取给定 GitHub 问题的详细信息，包括其标题、正文内容以及创建它的用户。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块接收 GitHub 凭据和问题 URL 作为输入。然后，它向 GitHub API 发送请求以获取问题的详细信息，并返回相关信息。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 GitHub 认证信息 问题 URL 要读取的 GitHub 问题的 URL

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 标题 问题的标题 正文 问题的主要内容或描述 用户 创建问题的用户的用户名 错误 如果读取问题失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 收集报告问题的信息以进行分析或在仪表板上显示。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个用于从 GitHub 仓库中检索问题列表的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块从指定的 GitHub 仓库中获取所有开放问题，并提供它们的标题和 URL。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块接收 GitHub 凭据和仓库 URL 作为输入。然后，它向 GitHub API 发送请求以获取问题列表，并返回它们的详细信息。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 GitHub 认证信息 仓库 URL 要列出问题的 GitHub 仓库的 URL

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 问题 问题列表，每个问题包含： - 标题 问题的标题 - URL 在 GitHub 上问题的直接链接 错误 如果列出问题失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 为项目状态报告创建开放问题的摘要或在项目管理仪表板上显示它们。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个用于向 GitHub 问题或拉取请求添加标签的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块允许用户向现有的 GitHub 问题或拉取请求添加指定的标签。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块接收 GitHub 凭据、问题或拉取请求的 URL 以及要添加的标签作为输入。然后，它向 GitHub API 发送请求，将标签添加到指定的问题或拉取请求。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 GitHub 认证信息 问题 URL 要添加标签的 GitHub 问题或拉取请求的 URL 标签 要添加的标签名称

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 状态 指示标签是否成功添加的消息 错误 如果添加标签失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 根据问题的内容自动分类问题或为新创建的问题分配优先级标签。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个用于从 GitHub 问题或拉取请求中移除标签的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块允许用户从现有的 GitHub 问题或拉取请求中移除指定的标签。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块接收 GitHub 凭据、问题或拉取请求的 URL 以及要移除的标签作为输入。然后，它向 GitHub API 发送请求，从指定的问题或拉取请求中移除标签。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 GitHub 认证信息 问题 URL 要移除标签的 GitHub 问题或拉取请求的 URL 标签 要移除的标签名称

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 状态 指示标签是否成功移除的消息 错误 如果移除标签失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 在问题通过工作流程进展时更新其状态，例如在问题完成时移除“进行中”标签。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个用于将用户分配到 GitHub 问题的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块允许用户将特定的 GitHub 用户分配到现有问题。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块接收 GitHub 凭据、问题的 URL 以及要分配的用户名作为输入。然后，它向 GitHub API 发送请求，将指定的用户分配到问题。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 GitHub 认证信息 问题 URL 要分配的 GitHub 问题的 URL 分配者 要分配到问题的用户的用户名

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 状态 指示问题是否成功分配的消息 错误 如果分配问题失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 根据团队成员的专长或工作量自动分配新问题。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个用于从 GitHub 问题中取消分配用户的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块允许用户从现有问题中移除特定 GitHub 用户的分配。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块接收 GitHub 凭据、问题的 URL 以及要取消分配的用户名作为输入。然后，它向 GitHub API 发送请求，从问题中移除指定用户的分配。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 GitHub 认证信息 问题 URL 要取消分配的 GitHub 问题的 URL 分配者 要从问题中取消分配的用户的用户名

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 状态 指示问题是否成功取消分配的消息 错误 如果取消分配问题失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 自动取消分配在一定时间内未活动的问题或在团队成员之间重新分配工作量。

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves a list of pull requests from a specified GitHub repository.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block fetches all open pull requests for a given GitHub repository and provides their titles and URLs.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: It connects to the GitHub API using the provided credentials and repository URL, then retrieves the list of pull requests and formats the information for easy viewing.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication details to access the repository Repository URL The URL of the GitHub repository to fetch pull requests from

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Pull Request A list of pull requests, each containing: - Title The title of the pull request - URL The web address of the pull request Error An error message if the operation fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A development team leader wants to quickly review all open pull requests in their project repository to prioritize code reviews.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that creates a new pull request in a specified GitHub repository.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to create a new pull request by providing details such as title, body, and branch information.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: It uses the GitHub API to create a new pull request with the given information, including the source and target branches for the changes.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication details to access the repository Repository URL The URL of the GitHub repository where the pull request will be created Title The title of the new pull request Body The description or content of the pull request Head The name of the branch containing the changes Base The name of the branch you want to merge the changes into

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Number The unique identifier of the created pull request URL The web address of the newly created pull request Error An error message if the pull request creation fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A developer has finished working on a new feature in a separate branch and wants to create a pull request to merge their changes into the main branch for review.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves detailed information about a specific GitHub pull request.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block fetches and provides comprehensive information about a given pull request, including its title, body, author, and optionally, the changes made.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: It connects to the GitHub API using the provided credentials and pull request URL, then retrieves and formats the requested information.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication details to access the repository Pull Request URL The URL of the specific GitHub pull request to read Include PR Changes An option to include the actual changes made in the pull request

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Title The title of the pull request Body The description or content of the pull request Author The username of the person who created the pull request Changes A list of changes made in the pull request (if requested) Error An error message if reading the pull request fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A code reviewer wants to get a comprehensive overview of a pull request, including its description and changes, before starting the review process.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that assigns a reviewer to a specific GitHub pull request.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to assign a designated reviewer to a given pull request in a GitHub repository.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: It uses the GitHub API to add the specified user as a reviewer for the given pull request.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication details to access the repository Pull Request URL The URL of the specific GitHub pull request to assign a reviewer to Reviewer The username of the GitHub user to be assigned as a reviewer

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Status A message indicating whether the reviewer was successfully assigned Error An error message if the reviewer assignment fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A project manager wants to assign a specific team member to review a newly created pull request for a critical feature.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that removes an assigned reviewer from a specific GitHub pull request.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to unassign a previously designated reviewer from a given pull request in a GitHub repository.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: It uses the GitHub API to remove the specified user from the list of reviewers for the given pull request.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication details to access the repository Pull Request URL The URL of the specific GitHub pull request to unassign a reviewer from Reviewer The username of the GitHub user to be unassigned as a reviewer

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Status A message indicating whether the reviewer was successfully unassigned Error An error message if the reviewer unassignment fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A team lead realizes that an assigned reviewer is unavailable and wants to remove them from a pull request to reassign it to another team member.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves a list of all assigned reviewers for a specific GitHub pull request.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block fetches and provides information about all the reviewers currently assigned to a given pull request in a GitHub repository.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: It connects to the GitHub API using the provided credentials and pull request URL, then retrieves and formats the list of assigned reviewers.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication details to access the repository Pull Request URL The URL of the specific GitHub pull request to list reviewers for

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Reviewer A list of assigned reviewers, each containing: - Username The GitHub username of the reviewer - URL The profile URL of the reviewer Error An error message if listing the reviewers fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A project coordinator wants to check who is currently assigned to review a specific pull request to ensure all necessary team members are involved in the code review process.

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块用于从指定的 GitHub 仓库中获取拉取请求列表。

docs.title: 功能作用
docs.text: 该模块会获取指定 GitHub 仓库中所有打开的拉取请求，并提供它们的标题和 URL。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 它使用提供的凭据和仓库 URL 连接到 GitHub API，然后获取拉取请求列表并格式化信息以便于查看。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 用于访问仓库的 GitHub 认证信息 仓库 URL 要获取拉取请求的 GitHub 仓库的 URL

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 拉取请求 拉取请求列表，每个包含： - 标题 拉取请求的标题 - URL 拉取请求的网页地址 错误 如果操作失败，返回错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 开发团队负责人希望快速查看项目仓库中所有打开的拉取请求，以便优先进行代码审查。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块用于在指定的 GitHub 仓库中创建新的拉取请求。

docs.title: 功能作用
docs.text: 该模块允许用户通过提供标题、正文和分支信息来创建新的拉取请求。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 它使用 GitHub API 根据提供的信息创建新的拉取请求，包括更改的源分支和目标分支。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 用于访问仓库的 GitHub 认证信息 仓库 URL 要在其中创建拉取请求的 GitHub 仓库的 URL 标题 新拉取请求的标题 正文 拉取请求的描述或内容 头部 包含更改的分支名称 基础 要将更改合并到的目标分支名称

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 编号 创建的拉取请求的唯一标识符 URL 新创建的拉取请求的网页地址 错误 如果拉取请求创建失败，返回错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 开发人员在一个单独的分支上完成了一个新功能的开发，并希望创建一个拉取请求，将其更改合并到主分支以供审查。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块用于获取特定 GitHub 拉取请求的详细信息。

docs.title: 功能作用
docs.text: 该模块获取并提供给定拉取请求的详细信息，包括其标题、正文、作者以及可选的更改内容。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 它使用提供的凭据和拉取请求 URL 连接到 GitHub API，然后获取并格式化请求的信息。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 用于访问仓库的 GitHub 认证信息 拉取请求 URL 要读取的特定 GitHub 拉取请求的 URL 包含拉取请求更改 是否包含拉取请求中的实际更改内容

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 标题 拉取请求的标题 正文 拉取请求的描述或内容 作者 创建拉取请求的用户名 更改 拉取请求中的更改列表（如果请求） 错误 如果读取拉取请求失败，返回错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 代码审查人员希望在开始审查过程之前，全面了解拉取请求的描述和更改内容。

docs.title: GitHub 分配拉取请求审查者
功能描述
docs.text: 该模块用于为特定的 GitHub 拉取请求分配审查者。

docs.title: 功能作用
docs.text: 该模块允许用户为 GitHub 仓库中的给定拉取请求分配指定的审查者。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 它使用 GitHub API 将指定的用户添加为给定拉取请求的审查者。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 用于访问仓库的 GitHub 认证信息 拉取请求 URL 要分配审查者的特定 GitHub 拉取请求的 URL 审查者 要分配为审查者的 GitHub 用户名

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 状态 指示审查者是否成功分配的消息 错误 如果审查者分配失败，返回错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 项目经理希望为关键功能的新创建的拉取请求分配特定的团队成员进行审查。

docs.title: GitHub 取消分配拉取请求审查者
功能描述
docs.text: 该模块用于从特定的 GitHub 拉取请求中移除已分配的审查者。

docs.title: 功能作用
docs.text: 该模块允许用户从 GitHub 仓库中的给定拉取请求中移除先前指定的审查者。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 它使用 GitHub API 从给定拉取请求的审查者列表中移除指定的用户。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 用于访问仓库的 GitHub 认证信息 拉取请求 URL 要取消分配审查者的特定 GitHub 拉取请求的 URL 审查者 要取消分配为审查者的 GitHub 用户名

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 状态 指示审查者是否成功取消分配的消息 错误 如果审查者取消分配失败，返回错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 团队负责人发现分配的审查者不可用，希望将其从拉取请求中移除并重新分配给其他团队成员。

docs.title: GitHub 列出拉取请求审查者
功能描述
docs.text: 该模块用于获取特定 GitHub 拉取请求的所有已分配审查者列表。

docs.title: 功能作用
docs.text: 该模块获取并提供 GitHub 仓库中给定拉取请求的所有当前已分配审查者的信息。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 它使用提供的凭据和拉取请求 URL 连接到 GitHub API，然后获取并格式化已分配审查者列表。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 用于访问仓库的 GitHub 认证信息 拉取请求 URL 要列出审查者的特定 GitHub 拉取请求的 URL

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 审查者 已分配审查者列表，每个包含： - 用户名 审查者的 GitHub 用户名 - URL 审查者的个人资料 URL 错误 如果列出审查者失败，返回错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 项目协调员希望检查当前谁被分配审查特定的拉取请求，以确保所有必要的团队成员都参与了代码审查过程。

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves and lists all tags for a specified GitHub repository.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block fetches all tags associated with a given GitHub repository and provides their names and URLs.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block connects to the GitHub API using provided credentials, sends a request to retrieve tag information for the specified repository, and then processes the response to extract tag names and URLs.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication credentials required to access the repository Repository URL The URL of the GitHub repository to fetch tags from

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Tag Information about each tag, including its name and URL Error Any error message if the tag listing process fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A developer wants to quickly view all release tags for a project to identify the latest version or track the project's release history.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves and lists all branches for a specified GitHub repository.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block fetches all branches associated with a given GitHub repository and provides their names and URLs.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block authenticates with the GitHub API, sends a request to get branch information for the specified repository, and then processes the response to extract branch names and URLs.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication credentials required to access the repository Repository URL The URL of the GitHub repository to fetch branches from

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Branch Information about each branch, including its name and URL Error Any error message if the branch listing process fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A project manager wants to review all active branches in a repository to track ongoing development efforts and feature implementations.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves and lists recent discussions for a specified GitHub repository.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block fetches a specified number of recent discussions from a given GitHub repository and provides their titles and URLs.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block uses the GitHub GraphQL API to request discussion data for the specified repository, processes the response, and extracts discussion titles and URLs.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication credentials required to access the repository Repository URL The URL of the GitHub repository to fetch discussions from Number of Discussions The number of recent discussions to retrieve (default is 5)

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Discussion Information about each discussion, including its title and URL Error Any error message if the discussion listing process fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A community manager wants to monitor recent discussions in a project's repository to identify trending topics or issues that need attention.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves and lists all releases for a specified GitHub repository.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block fetches all releases associated with a given GitHub repository and provides their names and URLs.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block connects to the GitHub API, sends a request to get release information for the specified repository, and then processes the response to extract release names and URLs.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication credentials required to access the repository Repository URL The URL of the GitHub repository to fetch releases from

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Release Information about each release, including its name and URL Error Any error message if the release listing process fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A user wants to view all official releases of a software project to choose the appropriate version for installation or to track the project's release history.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that reads the content of a specified file from a GitHub repository.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block retrieves the content of a specified file from a given GitHub repository, providing both the raw and decoded text content along with the file size.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block authenticates with the GitHub API, sends a request to fetch the specified file's content, and then processes the response to provide the file's raw content, decoded text content, and size.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication credentials required to access the repository Repository URL The URL of the GitHub repository containing the file File Path The path to the file within the repository Branch The branch name to read from (defaults to "master")

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Text Content The content of the file decoded as UTF-8 text Raw Content The raw base64-encoded content of the file Size The size of the file in bytes Error Any error message if the file reading process fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A developer wants to quickly view the contents of a configuration file or source code file in a GitHub repository without having to clone the entire repository.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that reads the content of a specified folder from a GitHub repository.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block retrieves the list of files and directories within a specified folder from a given GitHub repository.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block connects to the GitHub API, sends a request to fetch the contents of the specified folder, and then processes the response to provide information about files and directories within that folder.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication credentials required to access the repository Repository URL The URL of the GitHub repository containing the folder Folder Path The path to the folder within the repository Branch The branch name to read from (defaults to "master")

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description File Information about each file in the folder, including its name, path, and size Directory Information about each directory in the folder, including its name and path Error Any error message if the folder reading process fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A project manager wants to explore the structure of a repository or specific folder to understand the organization of files and directories without cloning the entire repository.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that creates a new branch in a GitHub repository.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block creates a new branch in a specified GitHub repository, based on an existing source branch.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block authenticates with the GitHub API, retrieves the latest commit SHA of the source branch, and then creates a new branch pointing to that commit.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication credentials required to access the repository Repository URL The URL of the GitHub repository where the new branch will be created New Branch The name of the new branch to create Source Branch The name of the existing branch to use as the starting point for the new branch

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Status A message indicating the success of the branch creation operation Error Any error message if the branch creation process fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A developer wants to start working on a new feature and needs to create a new branch based on the current state of the main development branch.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that deletes a specified branch from a GitHub repository.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block removes a specified branch from a given GitHub repository.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block authenticates with the GitHub API and sends a delete request for the specified branch.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials GitHub authentication credentials required to access the repository Repository URL The URL of the GitHub repository containing the branch to be deleted Branch The name of the branch to delete

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Status A message indicating the success of the branch deletion operation Error Any error message if the branch deletion process fails

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: After merging a feature branch into the main development branch, a developer wants to clean up the repository by removing the now-obsolete feature branch.

docs.title: 功能简介
docs.text: 一个用于获取并列出指定 GitHub 仓库所有标签的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块获取与指定 GitHub 仓库关联的所有标签，并提供它们的名称和 URL。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块使用提供的凭据连接到 GitHub API，发送请求以获取指定仓库的标签信息，然后处理响应以提取标签名称和 URL。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 访问仓库所需的 GitHub 认证凭据 仓库 URL 要获取标签的 GitHub 仓库的 URL

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 标签 每个标签的信息，包括其名称和 URL 错误 如果标签列出过程失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 开发者希望快速查看项目的所有发布标签，以识别最新版本或跟踪项目的发布历史。

docs.title: 功能简介
docs.text: 一个用于获取并列出指定 GitHub 仓库所有分支的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块获取与指定 GitHub 仓库关联的所有分支，并提供它们的名称和 URL。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块通过 GitHub API 进行身份验证，发送请求以获取指定仓库的分支信息，然后处理响应以提取分支名称和 URL。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 访问仓库所需的 GitHub 认证凭据 仓库 URL 要获取分支的 GitHub 仓库的 URL

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 分支 每个分支的信息，包括其名称和 URL 错误 如果分支列出过程失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 项目经理希望审查仓库中的所有活动分支，以跟踪正在进行的开发工作和功能实现。

docs.title: 功能简介
docs.text: 一个用于获取并列出指定 GitHub 仓库最近讨论的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块从指定 GitHub 仓库获取指定数量的最近讨论，并提供它们的标题和 URL。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块使用 GitHub GraphQL API 请求指定仓库的讨论数据，处理响应并提取讨论标题和 URL。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 访问仓库所需的 GitHub 认证凭据 仓库 URL 要获取讨论的 GitHub 仓库的 URL 讨论数量 要获取的最近讨论数量（默认为 5）

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 讨论 每个讨论的信息，包括其标题和 URL 错误 如果讨论列出过程失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 社区经理希望监控项目仓库中的最近讨论，以识别热门话题或需要关注的问题。

docs.title: 功能简介
docs.text: 一个用于获取并列出指定 GitHub 仓库所有发布的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块获取与指定 GitHub 仓库关联的所有发布，并提供它们的名称和 URL。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块连接到 GitHub API，发送请求以获取指定仓库的发布信息，然后处理响应以提取发布名称和 URL。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 访问仓库所需的 GitHub 认证凭据 仓库 URL 要获取发布的 GitHub 仓库的 URL

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 发布 每个发布的信息，包括其名称和 URL 错误 如果发布列出过程失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 用户希望查看软件项目的所有官方发布，以选择适合安装的版本或跟踪项目的发布历史。

docs.title: 功能简介
docs.text: 一个用于从 GitHub 仓库读取指定文件内容的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块从指定 GitHub 仓库中获取指定文件的内容，提供文件的原始和解码文本内容以及文件大小。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块通过 GitHub API 进行身份验证，发送请求以获取指定文件的内容，然后处理响应以提供文件的原始内容、解码文本内容和大小。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 访问仓库所需的 GitHub 认证凭据 仓库 URL 包含文件的 GitHub 仓库的 URL 文件路径 仓库中文件的路径 分支 要读取的分支名称（默认为 "master"）

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 文本内容 文件内容解码为 UTF-8 文本 原始内容 文件的原始 base64 编码内容 大小 文件的大小（以字节为单位） 错误 如果文件读取过程失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 开发者希望快速查看 GitHub 仓库中的配置文件或源代码文件的内容，而无需克隆整个仓库。

docs.title: 功能简介
docs.text: 一个用于从 GitHub 仓库读取指定文件夹内容的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块从指定 GitHub 仓库中获取指定文件夹内的文件和目录列表。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块连接到 GitHub API，发送请求以获取指定文件夹的内容，然后处理响应以提供该文件夹内文件和目录的信息。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 访问仓库所需的 GitHub 认证凭据 仓库 URL 包含文件夹的 GitHub 仓库的 URL 文件夹路径 仓库中文件夹的路径 分支 要读取的分支名称（默认为 "master"）

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 文件 文件夹中每个文件的信息，包括其名称、路径和大小 目录 文件夹中每个目录的信息，包括其名称和路径 错误 如果文件夹读取过程失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 项目经理希望探索仓库或特定文件夹的结构，以了解文件和目录的组织方式，而无需克隆整个仓库。

docs.title: 功能简介
docs.text: 一个用于在 GitHub 仓库中创建新分支的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块在指定 GitHub 仓库中基于现有源分支创建一个新分支。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块通过 GitHub API 进行身份验证，获取源分支的最新提交 SHA，然后创建一个指向该提交的新分支。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 访问仓库所需的 GitHub 认证凭据 仓库 URL 将在其中创建新分支的 GitHub 仓库的 URL 新分支 要创建的新分支的名称 源分支 用作新分支起点的现有分支的名称

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 状态 指示分支创建操作成功的消息 错误 如果分支创建过程失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 开发者希望开始开发新功能，并需要基于当前主开发分支的状态创建一个新分支。

docs.title: 功能简介
docs.text: 一个用于从 GitHub 仓库中删除指定分支的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块从指定 GitHub 仓库中删除指定分支。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 该模块通过 GitHub API 进行身份验证，并发送删除指定分支的请求。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 访问仓库所需的 GitHub 认证凭据 仓库 URL 包含要删除分支的 GitHub 仓库的 URL 分支 要删除的分支名称

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 状态 指示分支删除操作成功的消息 错误 如果分支删除过程失败，返回的错误信息

docs.title: 使用场景
docs.text: 在将功能分支合并到主开发分支后，开发者希望通过删除现在已过时的功能分支来清理仓库。

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves and reads emails from a Gmail account.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block searches for and retrieves emails from a specified Gmail account based on given search criteria. It can fetch multiple emails and provide detailed information about each email, including subject, sender, recipient, date, body content, and attachments.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block connects to the user's Gmail account using their credentials, performs a search based on the provided query, and retrieves the specified number of email messages. It then processes each email to extract relevant information and returns the results.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials The user's Gmail account credentials for authentication Query A search query to filter emails (e.g., "is:unread" for unread emails) Max Results The maximum number of emails to retrieve

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Email Detailed information about a single email Emails A list of email data for multiple emails Error An error message if something goes wrong during the process

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Automatically checking for new customer inquiries in a support email inbox and organizing them for quick response.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that sends emails using a Gmail account.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to compose and send emails through their Gmail account. It handles the creation of the email message and sends it to the specified recipient.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block authenticates with the user's Gmail account, creates an email message with the provided details (recipient, subject, and body), and then sends the email using Gmail's API.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials The user's Gmail account credentials for authentication To The recipient's email address Subject The subject line of the email Body The main content of the email

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Result Confirmation of the sent email, including a message ID Error An error message if something goes wrong during the process

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Automatically sending confirmation emails to customers after they make a purchase on an e-commerce website.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves all labels (categories) from a Gmail account.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block fetches and lists all the labels or categories that are set up in the user's Gmail account. These labels are used to organize and categorize emails.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block connects to the user's Gmail account and requests a list of all labels. It then processes this information and returns a simplified list of label names and their corresponding IDs.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials The user's Gmail account credentials for authentication

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Result A list of labels, including their names and IDs Error An error message if something goes wrong during the process

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Creating a dashboard that shows an overview of how many emails are in each category or label in a business email account.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that adds a label to a specific email in a Gmail account.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to add a label (category) to a particular email message in their Gmail account. If the label doesn't exist, it creates a new one.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block first checks if the specified label exists in the user's Gmail account. If it doesn't, it creates the label. Then, it adds the label to the specified email message using the message ID.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials The user's Gmail account credentials for authentication Message ID The unique identifier of the email message to be labeled Label Name The name of the label to add to the email

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Result Confirmation of the label addition, including the label ID Error An error message if something goes wrong during the process

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Automatically categorizing incoming customer emails based on their content, adding labels like "Urgent," "Feedback," or "Invoice" for easier processing.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that removes a label from a specific email in a Gmail account.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows users to remove a label (category) from a particular email message in their Gmail account.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block first finds the ID of the specified label in the user's Gmail account. If the label exists, it removes it from the specified email message using the message ID.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials The user's Gmail account credentials for authentication Message ID The unique identifier of the email message to remove the label from Label Name The name of the label to remove from the email

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Result Confirmation of the label removal, including the label ID Error An error message if something goes wrong during the process

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Automatically removing the "Unread" label from emails after they have been processed by a customer service representative.

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个用于从Gmail账户中检索和读取邮件的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块根据给定的搜索条件，从指定的Gmail账户中搜索并检索邮件。它可以获取多封邮件，并提供每封邮件的详细信息，包括主题、发件人、收件人、日期、正文内容和附件。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 模块使用用户的凭据连接到其Gmail账户，根据提供的查询执行搜索，并检索指定数量的邮件。然后，它处理每封邮件以提取相关信息并返回结果。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 用户的Gmail账户凭据，用于身份验证 查询 用于过滤邮件的搜索查询（例如，"is:unread"表示未读邮件） 最大结果数 要检索的邮件的最大数量

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 邮件 单封邮件的详细信息 邮件列表 多封邮件的数据列表 错误 如果过程中出现问题，返回错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 自动检查支持邮箱中的新客户咨询，并组织它们以便快速响应。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个使用Gmail账户发送邮件的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块允许用户通过其Gmail账户撰写并发送邮件。它处理邮件消息的创建并将其发送到指定的收件人。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 模块使用用户的Gmail账户进行身份验证，使用提供的详细信息（收件人、主题和正文）创建邮件消息，然后使用Gmail的API发送邮件。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 用户的Gmail账户凭据，用于身份验证 收件人 收件人的电子邮件地址 主题 邮件的主题行 正文 邮件的主要内容

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 结果 发送邮件的确认信息，包括消息ID 错误 如果过程中出现问题，返回错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 在电子商务网站上，客户完成购买后自动发送确认邮件。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个从Gmail账户中检索所有标签（类别）的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块获取并列出用户Gmail账户中设置的所有标签或类别。这些标签用于组织和分类邮件。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 模块连接到用户的Gmail账户，并请求所有标签的列表。然后，它处理这些信息并返回标签名称及其对应ID的简化列表。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 用户的Gmail账户凭据，用于身份验证

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 结果 标签列表，包括名称和ID 错误 如果过程中出现问题，返回错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 创建一个仪表板，显示业务邮箱中每个类别或标签中的邮件数量概览。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个向Gmail账户中的特定邮件添加标签的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块允许用户向其Gmail账户中的特定邮件添加标签（类别）。如果标签不存在，则创建新标签。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 模块首先检查用户Gmail账户中是否存在指定的标签。如果不存在，则创建该标签。然后，使用邮件ID将标签添加到指定的邮件中。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 用户的Gmail账户凭据，用于身份验证 邮件ID 要添加标签的邮件的唯一标识符 标签名称 要添加到邮件的标签名称

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 结果 标签添加的确认信息，包括标签ID 错误 如果过程中出现问题，返回错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 根据内容自动分类收到的客户邮件，添加如“紧急”、“反馈”或“发票”等标签以便于处理。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个从Gmail账户中的特定邮件中移除标签的模块。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块允许用户从其Gmail账户中的特定邮件中移除标签（类别）。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 模块首先在用户的Gmail账户中找到指定标签的ID。如果标签存在，则使用邮件ID从指定的邮件中移除该标签。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 凭据 用户的Gmail账户凭据，用于身份验证 邮件ID 要移除标签的邮件的唯一标识符 标签名称 要从邮件中移除的标签名称

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 结果 标签移除的确认信息，包括标签ID 错误 如果过程中出现问题，返回错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 在客户服务代表处理完邮件后，自动移除邮件中的“未读”标签。

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that reads data from a Google Sheets spreadsheet.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block retrieves information from a specified range within a Google Sheets spreadsheet.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block connects to Google Sheets using provided credentials, then fetches data from the specified spreadsheet and range.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials Authentication information required to access Google Sheets Spreadsheet ID The unique identifier of the spreadsheet you want to read from Range The specific area of the spreadsheet you want to read (e.g., "Sheet1!A1:B2")

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Result The data retrieved from the spreadsheet, organized in rows and columns Error Any error message that occurred during the process

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: A marketing team could use this block to automatically retrieve the latest campaign performance data from a shared Google Sheets document for analysis and reporting.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that writes data to a Google Sheets spreadsheet.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows you to input data into a specified range within a Google Sheets spreadsheet.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: The block authenticates with Google Sheets using provided credentials, then updates the specified spreadsheet range with the given data.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description Credentials Authentication information required to access Google Sheets Spreadsheet ID The unique identifier of the spreadsheet you want to write to Range The specific area of the spreadsheet where you want to write data (e.g., "Sheet1!A1:B2") Values The data you want to write to the spreadsheet, organized in rows and columns

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description Result Information about the write operation, such as the number of cells, columns, and rows updated Error Any error message that occurred during the process

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: An automated inventory system could use this block to update stock levels in a Google Sheets spreadsheet whenever products are sold or restocked, ensuring real-time inventory tracking.

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个用于从Google Sheets电子表格中读取数据的模块。

docs.title: 主要作用
docs.text: 该模块从指定的Google Sheets电子表格范围内获取信息。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 模块通过提供的凭证连接到Google Sheets，然后从指定的电子表格和范围内提取数据。

docs.title: 输入参数
docs.text: 输入项 描述 凭证 访问Google Sheets所需的认证信息 电子表格ID 要读取的电子表格的唯一标识符 范围 要读取的电子表格的特定区域（例如："Sheet1!A1:B2"）

docs.title: 输出结果
docs.text: 输出项 描述 结果 从电子表格中检索到的数据，按行和列组织 错误 过程中发生的任何错误信息

docs.title: 应用场景
docs.text: 营销团队可以使用此模块自动从共享的Google Sheets文档中获取最新的活动表现数据，用于分析和报告。

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 一个用于向Google Sheets电子表格中写入数据的模块。

docs.title: 主要作用
docs.text: 该模块允许你将数据输入到指定的Google Sheets电子表格范围内。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 模块使用提供的凭证与Google Sheets进行认证，然后用给定的数据更新指定的电子表格范围。

docs.title: 输入参数
docs.text: 输入项 描述 凭证 访问Google Sheets所需的认证信息 电子表格ID 要写入的电子表格的唯一标识符 范围 要写入数据的电子表格的特定区域（例如："Sheet1!A1:B2"） 值 要写入电子表格的数据，按行和列组织

docs.title: 输出结果
docs.text: 输出项 描述 结果 写入操作的相关信息，如更新的单元格、列和行数 错误 过程中发生的任何错误信息

docs.title: 应用场景
docs.text: 自动化库存系统可以使用此模块在商品售出或补货时更新Google Sheets电子表格中的库存水平，确保实时库存跟踪。

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that creates tweets on Twitter with various optional attachments and settings.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block allows posting tweets with text content and optional attachments like media, polls, quotes, or deep links.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: It uses the Twitter API (Tweepy) to create a tweet with the specified content and settings, handling authentication and error cases.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description credentials Twitter API credentials with required scopes tweet_text Main text content of the tweet attachment Optional media, deep link, poll, place or quote attachment for_super_followers_only Whether the tweet is exclusively for super followers exclude_reply_user_ids User IDs to exclude from reply thread in_reply_to_tweet_id ID of tweet being replied to reply_settings Who can reply to the tweet

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description tweet_id ID of the created tweet tweet_url URL to view the tweet error Error message if posting failed

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Automating tweet publishing with rich content like polls, media or quotes.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that deletes a specified tweet on Twitter.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block removes an existing tweet using its tweet ID.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: It uses the Twitter API (Tweepy) to delete the tweet with the given ID, handling authentication and error cases.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description credentials Twitter API credentials with required scopes tweet_id ID of the tweet to delete

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description success Whether deletion was successful error Error message if deletion failed

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Automated cleanup of old or irrelevant tweets.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that searches recent public tweets on Twitter.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block searches for tweets matching specified criteria with options for filtering and pagination.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: It queries the Twitter API (Tweepy) search endpoint with the provided parameters and returns matching tweets and metadata.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description credentials Twitter API credentials with required scopes query Search query string max_results Maximum number of results per page pagination Token for getting next page of results expansions Additional data fields to include start_time Start of search time window end_time End of search time window since_id Return results after this tweet ID until_id Return results before this tweet ID sort_order Order of returned results

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description tweet_ids List of matching tweet IDs tweet_texts List of tweet text contents next_token Token for retrieving next page data Complete tweet data included Additional requested data meta Pagination and result metadata error Error message if search failed

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Monitoring Twitter for mentions of specific topics or hashtags.

docs.title: What it is
docs.text: A block that retrieves quote tweets (tweets that quote a specific tweet) from Twitter.

docs.title: What it does
docs.text: This block gets a list of tweets that quote the specified tweet ID, with options for pagination and filtering.

docs.title: How it works
docs.text: It uses the Twitter API (Tweepy) to fetch quote tweets for a given tweet ID, handling authentication and returning tweet data with optional expansions.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description credentials Twitter API credentials with required scopes tweet_id ID of the tweet to get quotes for max_results Maximum number of results to return (max 100) exclude Types of tweets to exclude pagination_token Token for getting next page of results expansions Additional data fields to include more info. media_fields Media-related fields to include more info. place_fields Location-related fields to include more info. poll_fields Poll-related fields to include more info. tweet_fields Tweet-specific fields to include more info. user_fields User-related fields to include more info.

docs.title: Outputs
docs.text: Output Description ids List of quote tweet IDs texts List of quote tweet text contents next_token Token for retrieving next page more info. data Complete tweet data included Additional requested data more info. meta Pagination and result metadata more info. error Error message if request failed

docs.title: Possible use case
docs.text: Monitoring engagement and responses to specific tweets through quote tweets.

docs.text: It uses the Twitter API (Tweepy) to fetch retweeter information for a given tweet ID, handling authentication and returning user data with optional expansions.

docs.title: Inputs
docs.text: Input Description credentials Twitter API credentials with required scopes tweet_id ID of the tweet to get retweeters for max_results Maximum number of results per page (1-100) pagination_token Token for getting next page of results expansions Additional data fields to include more info. media_fields Media-related fields to include more info. place_fields Location-related fields to include more info. poll_fields Poll-related fields to include more info. tweet_fields Tweet-specific fields to include more info. user_fields User-related fields to include more info.

docs.title: Common Input
docs.text: The Twitter API lets you choose what information you want to get back when you make a request. Here are the different types of information you can ask for:

docs.title: expansions
docs.text:
Extra information about tweets, pictures, and users that are mentioned or connected

Field Description Poll_IDs Gets information about any polls in the tweet, like voting options and results Media_Keys Gets details about pictures, videos, or GIFs attached to the tweet Author_User_ID Gets information about who wrote the tweet, like their profile details Edit_History_Tweet_IDs Shows if and when the tweet was edited and what changed Mentioned_Usernames Gets profile information about any @mentioned users Place_ID Gets details about locations tagged in the tweet Reply_To_User_ID Gets information about the person this tweet is replying to Referenced_Tweet_ID Gets details about any tweets this one is quoting or retweeting Referenced_Tweet_Author_ID Gets profile information about who wrote the original tweets being referenced

docs.title: media_fields
docs.text:
Information about pictures, videos, and other media

Field Description Duration_in_Milliseconds How long a video or audio clip plays for (in milliseconds) Height How tall the picture or video is in pixels Media_Key A unique code that identifies this specific piece of media Preview_Image_URL Web link to a smaller preview version of the picture Media_Type What kind of media it is (photo, video, GIF, etc.) Media_URL Web link to view the full media Width How wide the picture or video is in pixels Public_Metrics Numbers anyone can see (views, plays, etc.) Non_Public_Metrics Private numbers only the tweet author can see Organic_Metrics Numbers about natural engagement (non-promoted) Promoted_Metrics Numbers about paid promotion performance Alternative_Text Description of the media for accessibility Media_Variants Different sizes/qualities available (like HD vs SD video)

docs.title: place_fields
docs.text:
Information about locations mentioned in tweets

Field Description Contained_Within_Places Larger areas this place is part of (like a city within a state) Country The full country name Country_Code Short two-letter code for the country (like US for United States) Full_Location_Name Complete name including city, state, country etc. Geographic_Coordinates Exact location on a map (latitude and longitude) Place_ID A unique code that identifies this specific location Place_Name The main name of the place (like "Times Square") Place_Type What kind of place it is (city, business, landmark etc.)

docs.title: poll_fields
docs.text:
Information about polls in tweets

Field Description Duration_Minutes How long the poll stays open for voting End_DateTime The exact date and time when voting closes Poll_ID A unique code that identifies this specific poll Poll_Options The different choices people can vote for Voting_Status Whether voting is still open or closed

docs.title: tweet_fields
docs.text:
Information about the tweets themselves

Field Description Tweet_Attachments All media, links, or polls included in the tweet Author_ID A unique code identifying who wrote the tweet Context_Annotations Extra information about what the tweet is about Conversation_ID Code linking all replies in a conversation Creation_Time When the tweet was posted Edit_Controls Whether the tweet can be edited and for how long Tweet_Entities Special parts of the tweet like #hashtags, @mentions, and links Geographic_Location Where the tweet was posted from Tweet_ID A unique code for this specific tweet Reply_To_User_ID Who this tweet is responding to Language What language the tweet is written in Public_Metrics Numbers like retweets, likes, and replies Sensitive_Content_Flag Warning if tweet might contain sensitive content Referenced_Tweets Other tweets this one is connected to Reply_Settings Who is allowed to reply to the tweet Tweet_Source What app or website was used to post Tweet_Text The actual words in the tweet Withheld_Content If the tweet is hidden in certain countries

docs.title: user_fields
docs.text:
Information about Twitter users

Field Description Account_Creation_Date When they joined Twitter User_Bio The "About me" text on their profile User_Entities Links and @mentions in their profile User_ID Their unique Twitter user code User_Location Where they say they are located Latest_Tweet_ID Code for their most recent tweet Display_Name Their full profile name (not @username) Pinned_Tweet_ID Code for the tweet stuck to top of their profile Profile_Picture_URL Link to their profile picture Is_Protected_Account Whether their tweets are private Account_Statistics Number of followers, following, and tweets Profile_URL Link to their profile webpage Username Their @handle they use on Twitter Is_Verified Whether they have a verification checkmark Verification_Type What kind of verification they have Content_Withholding_Info If their content is hidden in certain places

docs.title: Extra notes
docs.text:
• Use combinations of expansions and fields to build precise queries. For instance:
  • To fetch a Tweet with media details, include expansions=Media_Keys and relevant media_fields.

  • For user data in Tweets, add expansions=Author_User_ID and appropriate user_fields.

  • Data returned under includes helps cross-reference expanded data objects with their parent entities using IDs.

docs.title: Common Output
docs.text: The Twitter API returns standardized response elements across many endpoints. Here are the common output fields you'll encounter:

docs.title: data
docs.text:
The primary data requested in the response

Field Description ID Unique identifier for the object Type Type of object (tweet, user, etc) Properties Object-specific fields like text for tweets

docs.title: includes
docs.text:
Additional expanded data objects referenced in the primary data

Field Description Tweets Full tweet objects that were referenced Users User profile data for authors/mentions Places Location data for geo-tagged content Media Details about attached photos/videos Polls Information about embedded polls

docs.title: meta
docs.text:
Metadata about the response and pagination

Field Description Result_Count Number of items returned Next_Token Token to get next page of results Previous_Token Token to get previous page Newest_ID Most recent ID in results Oldest_ID Oldest ID in results Total_Tweet_Count Total matching tweets (search)

docs.title: errors
docs.text:
Details about any errors that occurred

Field Description Title Brief error description Detail Detailed error message Type Error category/classification Status HTTP status code

docs.title: Non-paginated responses
docs.text: For single-object lookups: - data: Contains requested object - includes: Referenced objects - errors: Any errors encountered

docs.title: Paginated responses
docs.text: For multi-object lookups: - data: Array of objects - includes: Referenced objects - meta: Pagination details - errors: Any errors encountered

docs.title: 功能概述
docs.text: 该模块用于在 Twitter 上发布带有各种可选附件和设置的推文。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块允许发布带有文本内容和可选附件（如媒体、投票、引用或深度链接）的推文。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 它使用 Twitter API（Tweepy）创建带有指定内容和设置的推文，处理身份验证和错误情况。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 credentials 具有所需范围的 Twitter API 凭证 tweet_text 推文的主要文本内容 attachment 可选的媒体、深度链接、投票、地点或引用附件 for_super_followers_only 推文是否仅对超级粉丝可见 exclude_reply_user_ids 排除在回复线程中的用户 ID in_reply_to_tweet_id 正在回复的推文 ID reply_settings 谁可以回复推文

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 tweet_id 创建的推文 ID tweet_url 查看推文的 URL error 如果发布失败，返回错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 自动化发布带有丰富内容（如投票、媒体或引用）的推文。

docs.title: 输入

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 success 删除是否成功 error 如果删除失败，返回错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 自动清理旧或不相关的推文。

docs.title: Twitter 搜索最近推文模块
功能概述
docs.text: 该模块用于搜索 Twitter 上最近的公开推文。

docs.title: 功能描述
docs.text: 该模块根据指定的条件搜索推文，并提供过滤和分页选项。

docs.title: 工作原理
docs.text: 它使用 Twitter API（Tweepy）的搜索端点，根据提供的参数查询并返回匹配的推文和元数据。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 credentials 具有所需范围的 Twitter API 凭证 query 搜索查询字符串 max_results 每页的最大结果数 pagination 获取下一页结果的令牌 expansions 包含的额外数据字段 start_time 搜索时间窗口的开始时间 end_time 搜索时间窗口的结束时间 since_id 返回此推文 ID 之后的结果 until_id 返回此推文 ID 之前的结果 sort_order 返回结果的顺序

docs.title: 输出
docs.text: 输出 描述 tweet_ids 匹配的推文 ID 列表 tweet_texts 推文文本内容列表 next_token 获取下一页的令牌 data 完整的推文数据 included 请求的额外数据 meta 分页和结果元数据 error 如果搜索失败，返回错误信息

docs.title: 可能的使用场景
docs.text: 监控 Twitter 上特定话题或标签的提及。

docs.title: 输入
docs.text: 输入 描述 credentials 具有所需范围的 Twitter API 凭证 tweet_id 要获取引用推文的推文 ID max_results 返回的最大结果数（最多 100） exclude 要排除的推文类型 pagination_token 获取下一页结果的令牌 expansions 包含的额外数据字段 更多信息。 media_fields 包含的媒体相关字段 更多信息。 place_fields 包含的地点相关字段 更多信息。 poll_fields 包含的投票相关字段 更多信息。 tweet_fields 包含的推文特定字段 更多信息。 user_fields 包含的用户相关字段 更多信息。

docs.title: 输出

docs.title: Testing
docs.text: We use Playwright for our testing framework.

docs.title: Before you start
docs.text: Almost all of the tests require that you are running the frontend and backend servers. You will hit strange and hard to debug errors if you don't have them running because the tests will try to interact with the application when it's not running in an interactable state.

docs.title: Running the tests
docs.text:
To run the tests, you can use the following commands:

Running the tests without the UI, and headless:

yarn test

If you want to run the tests in a UI where you can identify each locator used you can use the following command:

yarn test-ui

You can also pass --debug to the test command to open the browsers in view mode rather than headless. This works with both the yarn test and yarn test-ui commands.

yarn test --debug

In CI, we run the tests in headless mode, with multiple browsers, and retry a failed test up to 2 times.

You can find the full configuration in playwright.config.ts.

docs.title: Debugging tests
docs.text:
There's a lot of different ways to debug tests.

My preferred is a mix of playwright's test editor and vscode.

No matter what you do, you should always double check that your locators are correct. Playwright will often "time out" and not give you the error message that the locator is incorrect because it can't find the element. You can do this via devtools on your browser and they should be visible on the elements tab when you use the inspect and select elements tools.

docs.title: Using the playwright test editor
docs.text:
If you need to debug a test, you can use the below command to open the test in the playwright test editor. This is helpful if you want to see the test in the browser and see the state of the page as the test sees it and the locators it uses.

yarn test --debug --test-name-pattern="test-name"

docs.title: Using vscode
docs.text:
You can install the Playwright Test for VSCode extension to get autocomplete for the playwright api (id: ms-playwright.playwright).

Installing this will enable the Test Explorer view in vscode which allows you to run, debug, and view all tests in the current project. Adding breakpoints to your tests and running them will automatically open the test editor with the correct context.

docs.title: Setting up for generating tests
docs.text:
With playwright, you can generate tests from existing recordings of user sessions. This is useful for creating tests that are more representative of how a user would interact with the application. We generally use this for checking what ids stuff will have and what needs ids to be added.

It is super annoying to continuously login so I highly recommend using a saved session for your tests. This will save a file called .auth/gentest-user.json that can be loaded for all future gentests so that you don't have to login every time.

docs.title: Saving a session for gen tests to always use
docs.text:
yarn gentests --save-storage .auth/gentest-user.json

Stop your session with CTRL + C after you are logged in and swap the --save-storage flag with --load-storage to load the session for all future tests.

docs.title: Loading a session for gen tests to always use
docs.text: yarn gentests --load-storage .auth/gentest-user.json

docs.title: How to make a new test
docs.text:
Tests are composed of page objects and test files.

A page object is a class that contains methods for interacting with a page.

A test file is a file that contains tests for a page or a set of pages.

docs.title: Making a new Page Object
docs.text:
For tests, we use the page object model. This is a pattern where each page is a class that contains all the methods and locators for that page. This is useful for keeping your tests organized and easy to read as well as ensuring that your tests only need to be updated in one place when the UI changes.

You should make a new page object (only when needing to add a new page, or UI element that is across multiple tests) using the following example.

We extend the BasePage class which contains shared methods for pages that have the common functionality like a navbar. If you add something like that (for example a sidebar) you should add it to the BasePage class. Otherwise, you should make a new page object.

Each page object should be in its own file and be named like page-name.page.ts. A page object should contain methods that are actions that a user can do on that page. For example, clicking a button, filling out a form, etc. It should also contain the various helpful abstractions that are unique to that page. For example, the BuildPage has a method to connect blocks together.

This is a shortened example of a page object for the profile page:

frontend/src/tests/pages/profile.page.ts
export class ProfilePage extends BasePage {
  constructor(page: Page) {
    super(page);
  }

  async getDisplayedHandle(): Promise<string> {
    await this.waitForPageToLoad();
    const handle = await this.page.locator('input[name="handle"]').inputValue();
    if (!handle) {
      throw new Error("Handle not found");
    }
    return handle;
  }

  async getDisplayedName(): Promise<string> {
    await this.waitForPageToLoad();
    const displayName = await this.page
      .locator('input[name="displayName"]')
      .inputValue();
    if (!displayName) {
      throw new Error("Display name not found");
    }
    return displayName;
  }
}

docs.title: Making a new Test File
docs.text:
For tests, we use our page objects to create tests. Each test file should be in the tests folder and be named like test-name.spec.ts. A test file can contain multiple tests. Each of which shuld be related to the same conceptual function. For example, a test file for the build page could have tests for building agents, creating inputs and outputs, and connecting blocks. If the you wanted to speciifically test building agents, you could make a new test called building-agents.spec.ts.

Tests can inherit from one or more page objects, have pre-actions, and have post-actions, as well as many other features. You can learn more about the different features and how to use them here.

A good focused (unit or single concept) test will:

  • Have a short name that describes what it is testing
  • Have a single concept (building a agent, adding all blocks, connecting two blocks, etc.)
  • Check pre-conditions, actions, and post-conditions, as well as have multiple validations along the way

A good non-focused (integration or multiple concepts) test will:

  • Have a short name that describes what it is testing
  • Have multiple concepts (building agents, creating-?exporting->importing->running an agent, connecting blocks in multiple ways with multiple inputs and outputs, etc.)
  • Have a clear user experience that they are making sure works (for example, clicking the build button and making sure the agent is built, or clicking the export button and making sure the agent is exported and shows up in the monitoring system)
  • Not focus on a single concept, but instead test the flow of the application as a whole. Remember you're not testing the pixel perfect UI, but the user experience.

A good test suite will have a healthy mix of focused and non-focused tests.

docs.title: Example Focused Test & Explanation
Passing information between tests
docs.text:
You can pass information between tests using the testInfo object. This is useful for things like passing the id of an agent between beforeAll so that you can have a shared setup for multiple tests.

frontend/src/tests/monitor.spec.ts
test.describe("Monitor", () => {
  let buildPage: BuildPage;
  let monitorPage: MonitorPage;

  test.beforeEach(async ({ page, loginPage, testUser }, testInfo: TestInfo) => {
    buildPage = new BuildPage(page);
    monitorPage = new MonitorPage(page);

    // Start each test with login using worker auth
    await page.goto("/login");
    await loginPage.login(testUser.email, testUser.password);
    await test.expect(page).toHaveURL("/marketplace");

    // add a test agent
    const basicBlock = await buildPage.getDictionaryBlockDetails();
    const id = uuidv4();
    await buildPage.createSingleBlockAgent(
      `test-agent-${id}`,
      `test-agent-description-${id}`,
      basicBlock,
    );
    await buildPage.runAgent();
    // await monitorPage.navbar.clickMonitorLink();
    await page.goto("/monitoring"); // Library link now points to /library
    await monitorPage.waitForPageLoad();
    await test.expect(monitorPage.isLoaded()).resolves.toBeTruthy();
    testInfo.attach("agent-id", { body: id });
  });

  test("test can read the agent id", async ({ page }, testInfo) => {
    if (testInfo.attachments.length === 0 || !testInfo.attachments[0].body) {
      throw new Error("No agent id attached to the test");
    }
    const testAttachName = testInfo.attachments[0].body.toString();
    /// ... Do something with the agent id here
  });
});

docs.title: 测试
docs.text: 我们使用 Playwright 作为我们的测试框架。

docs.title: 开始之前
docs.text: 几乎所有的测试都需要你运行前端和后端服务器。如果你没有运行它们，你将会遇到奇怪且难以调试的错误，因为测试会尝试与应用程序交互，而应用程序并未处于可交互状态。

docs.title: 运行测试
docs.text:
要运行测试，你可以使用以下命令：

以无头模式运行测试，不显示 UI：

yarn test

如果你想在一个可以识别每个使用的定位器的 UI 中运行测试，你可以使用以下命令：

yarn test-ui

你还可以在测试命令中传递 --debug 参数，以在可见模式下打开浏览器，而不是无头模式。这适用于 yarn test 和 yarn test-ui 命令。

yarn test --debug

在 CI 中，我们以无头模式运行测试，使用多个浏览器，并在测试失败时重试最多 2 次。

你可以在 playwright.config.ts 中找到完整的配置。

docs.title: 调试测试
docs.text:
有很多不同的调试测试的方法。

我最喜欢的是结合使用 Playwright 的测试编辑器和 VSCode。

无论你做什么，你都应该**始终**仔细检查你的定位器是否正确。Playwright 经常会“超时”，并且不会给你定位器不正确的错误信息，因为它找不到元素。你可以通过浏览器中的开发者工具来检查，当你使用检查和选择元素工具时，它们应该在元素标签中可见。

docs.title: 使用 Playwright 测试编辑器
docs.text:
如果你需要调试测试，你可以使用以下命令在 Playwright 测试编辑器中打开测试。如果你想在浏览器中查看测试，并查看测试时页面的状态和使用的定位器，这会很有帮助。

yarn test --debug --test-name-pattern="test-name"

docs.title: 使用 VSCode
docs.text:
你可以安装 Playwright Test for VSCode 扩展，以获得 Playwright API 的自动补全（ID：ms-playwright.playwright）。

安装此扩展后，将在 VSCode 中启用 Test Explorer 视图，允许你运行、调试和查看当前项目中的所有测试。在你的测试中添加断点并运行它们将自动在正确的上下文中打开测试编辑器。

docs.title: 设置生成测试
docs.text:
使用 Playwright，你可以从现有的用户会话记录中生成测试。这对于创建更能代表用户如何与应用程序交互的测试非常有用。我们通常使用它来检查元素的 ID 以及需要添加 ID 的地方。

不断登录非常烦人，因此我强烈建议为你的测试使用保存的会话。 这将保存一个名为 .auth/gentest-user.json 的文件，可以在所有未来的生成测试中加载，这样你就不必每次都登录。

docs.title: 保存会话以供生成测试始终使用
docs.text:
yarn gentests --save-storage .auth/gentest-user.json

在你登录后，使用 CTRL + C 停止会话，并将 --save-storage 标志替换为 --load-storage，以加载会话供所有未来的测试使用。

docs.title: 加载会话以供生成测试始终使用
docs.text: yarn gentests --load-storage .auth/gentest-user.json

docs.title: 如何创建新测试
docs.text:
测试由页面对象和测试文件组成。

页面对象是一个包含与页面交互的方法的类。

测试文件是一个包含页面或一组页面的测试的文件。

docs.title: 创建新的页面对象
docs.text:
对于测试，我们使用 页面对象模型。这是一种模式，其中每个页面都是一个类，包含该页面的所有方法和定位器。 这对于保持测试的组织性和易读性非常有用，同时确保在 UI 更改时只需在一个地方更新测试。

你应该使用以下示例创建一个新的页面对象（仅在需要添加新页面或**跨多个测试的 UI 元素**时）。

我们扩展了 BasePage 类，该类包含具有共同功能的页面的共享方法，比如导航栏。如果你添加类似的东西（例如侧边栏），你应该将其添加到 BasePage 类中。否则，你应该创建一个新的页面对象。

每个页面对象应该在自己的文件中，并命名为 page-name.page.ts。 页面对象应该包含用户可以对该页面执行的操作的方法。例如，点击按钮、填写表单等。它还应该包含该页面独有的各种有用的抽象。例如，BuildPage 有一个连接块的方法。

这是一个简短的配置文件页面对象的示例：

frontend/src/tests/pages/profile.page.ts
export class ProfilePage extends BasePage {
  constructor(page: Page) {
    super(page);
  }

  async getDisplayedHandle(): Promise<string> {
    await this.waitForPageToLoad();
    const handle = await this.page.locator('input[name="handle"]').inputValue();
    if (!handle) {
      throw new Error("Handle not found");
    }
    return handle;
  }

  async getDisplayedName(): Promise<string> {
    await this.waitForPageToLoad();
    const displayName = await this.page
      .locator('input[name="displayName"]')
      .inputValue();
    if (!displayName) {
      throw new Error("Display name not found");
    }
    return displayName;
  }
}

docs.title: 创建新的测试文件
docs.text:
对于测试，我们使用我们的页面对象来创建测试。每个测试文件应该在 tests 文件夹中，并命名为 test-name.spec.ts。一个测试文件可以包含多个测试。每个测试应该与相同的概念功能相关。例如，构建页面的测试文件可以有构建代理、创建输入和输出以及连接块的测试。如果你想专门测试构建代理，你可以创建一个名为 building-agents.spec.ts 的新测试。

测试可以从一个或多个页面对象继承，具有预操作和后操作，以及许多其他功能。你可以在这里了解更多关于不同功能以及如何使用它们的信息 这里。

一个好的聚焦（单元 或 单一概念）测试将：

  • 有一个简短的名称，描述它正在测试的内容
  • 有一个单一的概念（构建代理、添加所有块、连接两个块等）
  • 检查前置条件、操作和后置条件，并在过程中进行多次验证

一个好的非聚焦（集成 或 多个概念）测试将：

  • 有一个简短的名称，描述它正在测试的内容
  • 有多个概念（构建代理、创建->导出->导入->运行代理、以多种方式连接块，具有多个输入和输出等）
  • 有一个明确的用户体验，确保其正常工作（例如，点击构建按钮并确保代理已构建，或点击导出按钮并确保代理已导出并显示在监控系统中）
  • 不专注于单一概念，而是测试应用程序的整体流程。记住你不是在测试像素完美的 UI，而是用户体验。

一个好的测试套件将有一个健康的聚焦和非聚焦测试的组合。

docs.title: 示例聚焦测试及解释
在测试之间传递信息
docs.text:
你可以使用 testInfo 对象在测试之间传递信息。这对于在 beforeAll 之间传递代理 ID 非常有用，以便你可以为多个测试共享设置。

frontend/src/tests/monitor.spec.ts
test.describe("Monitor", () => {
  let buildPage: BuildPage;
  let monitorPage: MonitorPage;

  test.beforeEach(async ({ page, loginPage, testUser }, testInfo: TestInfo) => {
    buildPage = new BuildPage(page);
    monitorPage = new MonitorPage(page);

    // Start each test with login using worker auth
    await page.goto("/login");
    await loginPage.login(testUser.email, testUser.password);
    await test.expect(page).toHaveURL("/marketplace");

    // add a test agent
    const basicBlock = await buildPage.getDictionaryBlockDetails();
    const id = uuidv4();
    await buildPage.createSingleBlockAgent(
      `test-agent-${id}`,
      `test-agent-description-${id}`,
      basicBlock,
    );
    await buildPage.runAgent();
    // await monitorPage.navbar.clickMonitorLink();
    await page.goto("/monitoring"); // Library link now points to /library
    await monitorPage.waitForPageLoad();
    await test.expect(monitorPage.isLoaded()).resolves.toBeTruthy();
    testInfo.attach("agent-id", { body: id });
  });

  test("test can read the agent id", async ({ page }, testInfo) => {
    if (testInfo.attachments.length === 0 || !testInfo.attachments[0].body) {
      throw new Error("No agent id attached to the test");
    }
    const testAttachName = testInfo.attachments[0].body.toString();
    /// ... 在这里对代理 ID 做一些事情
  });
});
